Description: Plastic female head from a fitting on a Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery lekane; white slip (almost completely worn); maeander pattern on the left side of bust; traces of ears, hair and necklace remaining.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Compare the inscribed 'Aphrodite bowl' (British Museum 1888,0601.456 and joining fragment 1924,1201.418), also from Naukratis. See also University College London, UCL 750. The plastic head is also published in: Boardman, J., Excavations in Chios 1952-1955: Greek Emporio. Oxford 1967, 194, no. 9. Such large bowls, for which the potter and coroplast worked together (most probably under the same person) were perhaps a special creation for a ritual use, perhaps even in the ceremonial washing of the hands at the symposium.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2064) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
